intro: Cynometra lujae, commonly known as the African satinwood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Sapindaceae and is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by woody, spherical fruits containing several flat, winged seeds. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils in lowland and montane forests. Due to its ornamental value and timber quality, it is sometimes cultivated in horticultural settings.
